info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 5:11PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Davie, southeastern Iredell and western Rowan Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 511 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Statesville, or 4 miles southwest of Cleveland, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Statesville, Mooresville, Cooleemee, Cleveland, Enochville, Mount Ulla, Piedmont Research Station, Woodleaf and Cool Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
